dt-api.name: fixedColumns().left()
dt-api.summary: Get / set the number of fixed columns on the left side of a table

type.returns: The number of columns that are fixed to the left.
type.description: Getter for the number of columns fixed to the left.

type.parameter: The new number of columns to fix to the left. As of FixedColumns 4.3 a check is made to make sure that the value given is with in the range of 0 to the number of columns in the table (inclusive).
type.description: Updates the DataTable to fix the new number of columns to the left.

dt-api.description:
This method is either a getter or a setter for the number of columns that are fixed to the left of the table. If no argument is supplied then the method acts as a getter. If an argument is provided then that value is set as the new number of columns to be fixed to the left and the table is updated.
As of FixedColumns 5 this method is text direction aware and will fix columns at the left hand side of the table regardless of text direction.
